description.narrative: National Resilience Programme- Department of Disaster Management (DDM) Part Mainstreaming resilience and overall protecting human development progress from shocks and risk through Sendai Framework Implementation and Preparedness for mega disaster

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: OUTPUT 1: Improved capacities for risk-informed and gender-responsive development planning. Responsible sub project(s): DDM part and Programming Division part Indicator 1.7: Progress towards establishment of monitoring mechanism for Sendai framework implementation. Target: 08 points OUTPUT 2: Strengthened disability inclusive, gender-responsive national capacities to address recurrent and mega disasters. Responsible sub project(s): DDM part Indicator 2.1: Gaps, strengths and constraints for mega disaster preparedness in current allocation of mandates in Standing Orders on Disaster (SOD) are known to key stakeholders. Target: 06 points Indicator 2.2: Sex, age and disability disaggregation is institutionalized in GoB post-disaster data collection tools and protocols (equivalent to SP indicator: 1.3.1.1 Recovery plans and systems in place utilizing sex, age and disability disaggregated data and gender analysis (SP 2018-2021). Target: 02 points Indicator 2.3: Percentage of NRP trained government officials self-reporting utilization of gender-responsive recovery planning in their work, with reference to named progrmmes/ projects. Target: 75% (to be measured at midterm or completion) (2021) Indicator 2.4: Progress towards formulation and dissemination to key organizations of gender responsive curriculum and training capacity on light search and rescue. Target: Target: 06 points OUTPUT 5: Strengthened disability inclusive, gender responsive community preparedness, response and recovery capacities for recurrent and mega disasters. Responsible sub project: DDM & DWA Indicator 5.1: DRR inclusive social safety net – guideline and piloting results are in place. Target: 03 points Indicator 5.2 No. of policy briefs on disaster risk reduction activities with persons with disabilities disseminated to policymakers Target: 02 points Indicator 5.3: Progress towards institutionalization Flood Preparedness Programme (FPP) utilizing gender-responsive messaging with volunteers (

comment.narrative: 1.7. Mechanism does not exist; current MoDMR organogram does not allocate adequate human resource for DMIC or Sendai monitoring (0 points). 2.1. Institutions are inadequately equipped about their roles and responsivities in SOD (01 Point) 2.2. Current government post-disaster data collection forms do not require SADD. (0 points) 2.3. 0 point 2.3. 0 point 5.1. 0 point 5.2. 0 point 5.3. FPP system, training and resources piloted within local DMCs and received positive feedback from government, is however not institutionalized (0 points). 5.4. 0 point 5.5. 0 point 5.8. 0 point 5.9. 01 point 5.10. 0 point 5.11. 0 point

OUTPUT 2: Strengthened disability inclusive, gender-responsive national capacities to address recurrent and mega disasters. Responsible sub project(s): DDM part Indicator 2.1: Gaps, strengths and constraints for mega disaster preparedness in current allocation of mandates in Standing Orders on Disaster (SOD) are known to key stakeholders. Target: 01 points Indicator 2.3: Percentage of NRP trained government officials self-reporting utilization of gender-responsive recovery planning in their work, with reference to named progrmmes/ projects. Target: 75% (to be measured at midterm or completion) (2021) OUTPUT 5: Strengthened disability inclusive, gender responsive community preparedness, response and recovery capacities for recurrent and mega disasters. Responsible sub project: DDM & DWA Indicator 5.1: DRR inclusive social safety net – guideline and piloting results are in place. Target: 01 points Indicator 5.2 No. of policy briefs on disaster risk reduction activities with persons with disabilities disseminated to policymakers Target: 01 points Indicator 5.3: Progress towards institutionalization Flood Preparedness Programme (FPP) utilizing gender-responsive messaging with volunteers (equivalent to UNDP SP indicator: Indicator 3.3.1.1 Existence of operational end-to-end multi-sectoral early warning systems (EWS) to limit the gender-differentiated impact of:a) Natural hazards b) Health shocks (e.g. pandemics) c) Economic crises d) Other risk factors Target: 02 points Indicator 5.4: No. of people (disaggregated by gender, age and disability) benefiting from increased access to early warning information from FPP expansion (Probing “benefits”: reduce asset loss, moving to shelter, etc) Target: 129,600 Peoples [2021] Indicator 5.5: Progress toward development of Model on Inclusive Social Safety Net Programme (SSNP) meeting disaster specific needs of women and enhancing disaster resilience Target: 02 points Indicator 5.8: Progress towards inclusion of Forecast-Based Financing/Action within DDM operations Target: 02 points Indicator 5.11: Percentage of at-risk population covered by community level disaster management plans. Target : 20% population (Age, gender & disability) of the working areas at flood and earthquake prone location.

1. 7. SFDRR monitoring and reporting mechanism has been activated through a technical committee at MoDMR).- Achieved 01 point. 2.1. In progress 2.3. In progress 5.1. Not Yet Done 5.2. In progress 5.3. In progress 5.4. In Progress 5.5. DRR inclusive schemes and Resilient livelihood Options are introduced. - Achieved 01 point & rest of the point achieve by 31 December 2021. 5.8. FbF taskforce formed and activated through meetings.- Achieved 04 point 5.10.In progress: dissemination of lesson learnings will be conducted in 2021 5.11. In progress: To be measured in final programme evaluation in 2021.

OUTPUT 1: Improved capacities for risk-informed and gender-responsive development planning. Responsible sub project(s): DDM part and Programming Division part Indicator 1.7: Progress towards establishment of monitoring mechanism for Sendai framework implementation. Target: 02 points OUTPUT 2: Strengthened disability inclusive, gender-responsive national capacities to address recurrent and mega disasters. Responsible sub project(s): DDM part Indicator 2.1: Gaps, strengths and constraints for mega disaster preparedness in current allocation of mandates in Standing Orders on Disaster (SOD) are known to key stakeholders. Target: 03 points Indicator 2.4: Progress towards formulation and dissemination to key organizations of gender responsive curriculum and training capacity on light search and rescue. Target: Target: 05 points OUTPUT 5: Strengthened disability inclusive, gender responsive community preparedness, response and recovery capacities for recurrent and mega disasters. Responsible sub project: DDM & DWA Indicator 5.1: DRR inclusive social safety net – guideline and piloting results are in place. Target: 01 points Indicator 5.2 No. of policy briefs on disaster risk reduction activities with persons with disabilities disseminated to policymakers Target: 01 points Indicator 5.3: Progress towards institutionalization Flood Preparedness Programme (FPP) utilizing gender-responsive messaging with volunteers (equivalent to UNDP SP indicator: Indicator 3.3.1.1 Existence of operational end-to-end multi-sectoral early warning systems (EWS) to limit the gender-differentiated impact of:a) Natural hazards b) Health shocks (e.g. pandemics) c) Economic crises d) Other risk factors Target: 05 points Indicator 5.5: Progress toward development of Model on Inclusive Social Safety Net Programme (SSNP) meeting disaster specific needs of women and enhancing disaster resilience Target: 01 points Indicator 5.8: Progress towards inclusion of Forecast-Based Financing/Action within DDM operations Target: 02 points Indicator 5.9: Progress toward Development of Location Specific Dynamic Flood Risk model for upscaling. Target: 02 points Indicator 5.10: Progress towards formulation of minimum earthquake preparedness package for cities for scaling-up through government programme Target: 04 points

1.7. Point. Initiated data processing and analysis for SFDRR monitor data feeding. Beside this, SFDRR monitoring & reporting issues was sensitized in several multi-ministerial meetings.- Achieved 01 Points. 2. 1. Around 850 people from Government officials, Journalists and DMC members at various level have been oriented on SOD 2019. Bangla and English version of SOD 2019 has been made available for wide range of stakeholders through disseminating 20000 copies of SOD 2019. Earthquake study findings was shared with DDM.- Achieved 03 Points. 2.4. Developed a session on Gender to include in the existing Fire Service and Civil Defense (FSCD) training curriculum for Urban Community Volunteers and Flood Preparedness Volunteers. Reviews and validations done through online platform due to COVID-19.- Achieved 02 Points. [ Last revision of Prodoc removed 2.4. activity] 5.1. Piloting EGPP guideline is ongoing at Kurigram and Jamalpur. In addition, NRP DDM part contributed in developing EGPP++ Guideline for DDM.- Achieved 1 Point. 5.2. In view to have two policy briefs in 2020, the sub-project has started implementing the piloting on disability inclusive DRR. DiDRR activities contributed in developing RRAP and guideline/training module.- Achieved 1 Point. 5.3.1440 FPP volunteers developed. Formed volunteer groups in 20 Unions in two districts and developed operational guidelines based on which training provided. Developed Gender sessions to include in existing Fire Service and Civil Defense (FSCD) training curriculum for Urban Community Volunteers and Flood Preparedness Volunteers. Finalized volunteers list handed over to Unions. COVID Contingency plans developed both for DDM and MoDMR. - Achieved 05 Points. 5.5. Based on technical guidelines, EGPP beneficiaries, Project Implementation Officers (PIO) and UP representative were trained, and schemes were selected for implementation.- Achieved 01 Points. 5.8.Formation of Task Force (as per SOD) for early action in progress. However, NRP facilitated activation of National Disaster Management Advisory Committee (NDMAC). - Achieved 02 Points. 5.9. Developed the location specific Dynamic Flood Risk model and devised a framework for early warning dissemination. - Achieved 02 Points. 5.10. 6 ward level contingency plans drafted. 960 volunteers out of 2000 trained. BC committees are activated following GoB Circular.- Achieved 03 Points. 5.11.

1.7. Completed Sendai meeting Seminar with Parliamentary Standing Committee on SF Monitor, Sendai meeting Training on SFDRR monitoring and revised D-Form aligned with customized SFDRR monitoring indicators. - Achieved 06 points 2.1. Completed Standing Orders on Disaster (SOD) revision, submission and getting approval. - Achieved - 03 points 2.2. Sex, age and disability disaggregation is institutionalized in GoB post-disaster data collection tools and protocols in D-Form through SOD 2019.- - Achieved 02 points. 2.3. Not applicable for 2019. 2.4. Completed Multi stakeholder consultation on gender responsive SAR curriculum- Achieved 01 point. 5.1. Completed Review existing safety net (EGPP) guidelines. - Achieved 01 point. 5.5. Based on technical guidelines, EGPP beneficiaries, Project Implementation Officers (PIO) and UP representative were trained, and schemes were selected for implementation. - Achieved 01 point. 5.8. Formation of Task Force (as per SOD) for early action in progress. However, NRP facilitated activation of National Disaster Management Advisory Committee (NDMAC). - Achieved 02 points. 5.10. Formed and activated WDMCs, BC Committees, Volunteers Groups and conducted training for volunteers in working areas. - Achieved 4 Points.

N/A Project implementation kicked off in last quarter of 2018, target was not set for this year according to results framework.
However, Office setup, staff recruitment, steering and implementation committee formation and formally programme launching could be considered as target for inception phase.

Formation of joint programme steering committee, joint programme implementation committee was formed and Annual work plan was approved in the inception phase. NRP formally launched in mid of November 2018.
